text: For food served in a civil service institution, decent value for money. Add to that the air-conditioned comfort of a newly refurbished library, no reason to go out of the compound for lunch anymore.

Excellent food at economical price!  The lemon grass prawn salad comes highly recommended. It is an explosion of flavours being sweet sour and tangy with chunks of mango and grilled turmeric prawns. The finely sliced ginger flower acentuates the dish further with the lemon grass. The seafood gratin is cheesy and creamy with smoked salmon making it a very satisfying meal. The chilli crab pasta is spicy with generous serving of real crab meat. It took quite a while to adjust to the idea of having to eat restaurant standard meal with disposable and flimsy plastic cutlery. Also hope the management will consider a more environmental stance by reducing the use of plastic.

$4 for a tiny bowl of coagulated mushroom soup and a tiny half slice of bread. The images they used to advertise for their food seem to be stock images from the internet. Non-environmentally friendly service ware used also.

I was on course and really needed a coffee. I waited for 20 minutes and numerous people came and went without being served. I rang the ball and so did a few people after me. Idk where the dude went. Buy ur coffee before u come in.

$9
Ok the meat is very little. But i love the milk tea.
